Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of votes counted after midnight on Election Day in Michigan, stating that they are all fraud.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that as long as the ballots are received by 8 p.m. on Election Day, they can be counted, even if it takes time to process them.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that any votes counted after midnight are fraudulent, without providing evidence or proof to support this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that all votes counted after midnight are fraudulent.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the delay in counting ballots, such as the increase in mail-in voting due to the COVID-19 pandemic and the processing time required for mail-in ballots.
